channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Election officials on edge as voting begins. And, Haitians suffer from Trump's claims
item.description: General election voting for 2024 is commencing as election officials worry about the threat level they face. And, the Haitian community is suffering from Trump's false claims that they eat pets.
item.content:encoded:
General election voting for 2024 is commencing as election officials worry about the threat level they face. And, the Haitian community is suffering from Trump's false claims that they eat pets.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: A “golden age” of rat research may be here. What the often unwanted companions can teach us about us
item.description: Rat and human lives have long intersected, but there's little relatively little research about them. Thanks to advances in genomics and paleoarcheology mean a lot more study may be on the horizon.
item.content:encoded:
Rat and human lives have long intersected, but there's little relatively little research about them. Thanks to advances in genomics and paleoarcheology mean a lot more study may be on the horizon.

(Image credit: Gary Hershorn)
item.dc:creator: Nathan Rott

item.title: 2 former migrant farmworkers reflect on their journey together
item.description: Emma and Rogelio Torres reminisce about how unlikely a pairing they were when they first met as migrant farmworkers in Arizona. They met in the 80s near Yuma — with love the last thing on their minds.
item.content:encoded: Emma and Rogelio Torres reminisce about how unlikely a pairing they were when they first met as migrant farmworkers in Arizona. They met in the 80s near Yuma — with love the last thing on their minds.
item.dc:creator: Jo Corona

item.title: Voters are advised to return their ballots early because of mail delay concerns
item.description: Election officials are raising concerns about the U.S. Postal Service's ability to handle this fall’s expected influx of election mail. But USPS say it’s ready to deliver the country’s ballots.
item.content:encoded:
Election officials are raising concerns about the U.S. Postal Service's ability to handle this fall’s expected influx of election mail. But USPS say it’s ready to deliver the country’s ballots.

(Image credit: Nati Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Hansi Lo Wang

item.title: Deadly high blood pressure during pregnancy is on the rise
item.description: More pregnant women are being diagnosed with dangerously high blood pressure, which risks the life of the parent and child. Montana is one of the states improving screening and treatment.
item.content:encoded:
More pregnant women are being diagnosed with dangerously high blood pressure, which risks the life of the parent and child. Montana is one of the states improving screening and treatment.

(Image credit: Thom Bridge for KFF Health News)
item.dc:creator: Katheryn Houghton

item.title: Turkey wants to regulate Germany's beloved döner kebab street food
item.description: Under Turkey's proposal, beef would be required to come from cattle that is at least 16 months old, and be marinated with specific amounts of fat, yogurt or milk, onion, salt, thyme, and pepper.
item.content:encoded:
Under Turkey's proposal, beef would be required to come from cattle that is at least 16 months old, and be marinated with specific amounts of fat, yogurt or milk, onion, salt, thyme, and pepper.

(Image credit: Ebrahim Noroozi)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: An iconic Churchill photo stolen in Canada and found in Italy is ready to return
item.description: Canadian and Italian dignitaries marked the successful recovery of a portrait of Winston Churchill known as "The Roaring Lion," stolen in Canada and recovered in Italy after a two-year search.
item.content:encoded:
Canadian and Italian dignitaries marked the successful recovery of a portrait of Winston Churchill known as "The Roaring Lion," stolen in Canada and recovered in Italy after a two-year search.

(Image credit: Alessandra Tarantino)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Shohei Ohtani becomes the first MLB player to top 50 homers and 50 steals in a season
item.description: The Los Angeles Dodgers star reached the 50-50 milestone in his 150th game. He was already the sixth player in MLB history and the fastest ever to reach 40 home runs and 40 stolen bases in a season.
item.content:encoded:
The Los Angeles Dodgers star reached the 50-50 milestone in his 150th game. He was already the sixth player in MLB history and the fastest ever to reach 40 home runs and 40 stolen bases in a season.

(Image credit: Marta Lavandier)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Retiring Later in China; Getting a Driver's License in Mexico
item.description: In China the government is raising the official retirement age to combat a rapidly shrinking workforce. We hear reaction from Chinese workers. And life in Mexico City presents many challenges for people there. But getting a driving license isn't one of them.
item.content:encoded: In China the government is raising the official retirement age to combat a rapidly shrinking workforce. We hear reaction from Chinese workers. And life in Mexico City presents many challenges for people there. But getting a driving license isn't one of them.
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: A woman sustains leg burns after straying from Yellowstone trail
item.description: The 60-year-old woman, who has not been named, was near the Old Faithful Geyser at the Wyoming national park this week when she stepped through a thin crust over scalding water, park officials said.
item.content:encoded:
The 60-year-old woman, who has not been named, was near the Old Faithful Geyser at the Wyoming national park this week when she stepped through a thin crust over scalding water, park officials said.

(Image credit: Matthew Brown)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman
